It is important to note that while ACE inhibitors are a type of medication, they are not themselves chemicals. ACE inhibitors are a class of drugs that are used to treat various medical conditions, including high blood pressure and heart failure. They work by blocking the action of a substance in the body called angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE), which helps to narrow blood vessels and increase blood pressure. By blocking the action of ACE, ACE inhibitors help to widen blood vessels and lower blood pressure.

CHF, or congestive heart failure, is a medical condition in which the heart is unable to pump blood efficiently, leading to a buildup of fluid in the body. It is not a chemical entity.
